result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Anthony Shanks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Any vehicle driven by or registered to Defendant during period of drivers license revocation must be equipped with Ignition Interlock Device unless otherwise ordered by the Court.
Obtain alcohol assessment through Door County Human Services and comply with treatment recommendations.

miscConds.notes: $1800 fine plus costs. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant is required to attend the Victim Impact Panel scheduled for 6/12/14. Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 2 years if all conditions, including payment of all financial obligations, have been completed and with recommendation of Dept. of Corrections. Submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: 10 days of sentence are stayed.  If Defendant attends the Victim Impact Panel scheduled for 6/12/14, stay will be permanent.  If Defendant fails to attend, stay will be lifted. Good time and Huber privileges granted. Report forthwith. Court grants 5 day furlough - starting date to be worked out with Jail.

chargeModifiers.descr: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brian Anthony Shanks in court with attorney Eric S. Maciolek.  Defendant Brian Anthony Shanks in custody.  Ray Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty. Court reviews collateral consequences for felony conviction. Bond is no longer in effect.
Additional Request for Electronic Discovery for Door County Cases
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas.  Defense advises that Defendant would like to resolve case ASAP, but there's no blood result.  State believes it will be about a week.

Defendant Brian Anthony Shanks in court with attorney Eric S. Maciolek.  Defendant Brian Anthony Shanks in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim.  Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.  Status conference scheduled for March 12, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Brian Anthony Shanks in court with attorney Elisabeth Stockbridge.  Defendant Brian Anthony Shanks in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defense in Court. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defense requests prelim within time limits  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 5, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license.  Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Brian Anthony Shanks appeared by video conference.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges.  Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel.  Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 3/3/14, 10:00.
